name: places/ChIJ9dpLhoxbwokRgPhfWnUombk
formattedAddress: 42 Allen St #2FL, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 42 Allen St #2FL, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: I’ve been to a few table tennis places in Manhattan and this place was the best! It’s very clean and well organized place so it’s easy to visit and safe and fun! You also can get your playing video through the pad on a wall next to your table. It was very nice experience. I will definitely visit again here soon. It was all great!

originalText.text: Good place to get a nice little workout.  The replay videos are an added bonus. Most of the times you can find your level of players.  Paddles and balls are provided, and online booking is easy. Uses, slack channel for community. If you are  in lower east side and like ping pong, this is the place.

Paddles and balls are provided, and online booking is easy. Uses, slack channel for community. If you are  in lower east side and like ping pong, this is the place.

originalText.text: It was my first time playing at Ping Pod. It's a nice space to play table tennis. Really enjoyed the digital scoring and the ball picker. It really helps to focus on just playing. I'm only docking some stars because I don't like the reservation system. It costs extra to pick which table you want to play at, I feel it should be set to first come first serve for table selection. When I opted for the auto pick I assumed we would get either T1 or T2 (the tables with more space) since there were no other reservations at the time. However, even though T1 was open and empty during our stay, the system placed us in the cramped T3. It makes no sense to leave the better tables empty. If they were going to auto assign tables it shouldn't default in assigning the worse table first.

originalText.text:
Very cool concept and business model - definitely works well with the Covid era. Everything is done through their website- how it works, pricing, safety and guidelines, locations etc. If you’ve love ping pong as a kid like me, this is the perfect place for you. Whether you’re a beginner and need classes (you can sign up with an instructor) or just want table time, look no furthered.

Spacious and open. Balls and paddles provided. They also have a net apparatus that can pick up all the ping pong balls with you needing to bend over. Overall, I really enjoyed my experience here. The pricing varies depending on off-peak and peak hours.

originalText.text: really efficient and modern way to run a game hall. the service over the phone was really prompt and helpful whenever i had questions but besides that coming in and just playing in the space is really awesome and there's plenty of room and generally a great community of people. can't wait to keep coming.
